pullRequest.title: [systemtest][upgrade] Make testUpgradeKafkaWithoutVersion use examples from last released version
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: Lukas Kral lukywill16@gmail.com
Type of change

Bugfix/fix

Description
Until now in testUpgradeKafkaWithoutVersion we used KafkaResource.kafkaPersistent() for deploying the Kafka (persistent) with last released operator. Problem here was that when we changed something in Kafka CR (like our listeners), the KafkaResource is different to the KafkaResource from the last version. So the CO doesn't have to support these changes and the Kafka CR will not be even created.
This PR fixes this problem and allows us to use Kafka from last version using example kafka-persistent.yaml.
Checklist

 Make sure all tests pass (not possible due issue #3685)

commit.message:
change testUpgradeKafkaWithoutVersion to use example kafka from last released version

Signed-off-by: Lukas Kral <lukywill16@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Should we also add CLUSTER_NAME as a parameter and change it in the kafkaPersistent? It is "hardcoded" in the yaml to be my-cluster but in the ST it might be changed eventually.
I guess you need to also change the message format version?
Can this be some constant somewhere on the beginning? (the version I mean)
Wouldnt be better to use this from kafka-versions.yaml?

commit.message:
fixup! scholzj comments

Signed-off-by: Lukas Kral <lukywill16@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Why does this needs to be a class parameter? Why not pass it directly into the single method using it?
Why not read the file into the Kafka class which you can configure directly? It would be easier than going through the JSON tree, or?

Out of curiosity, what is the philosophy of this test with regards to versions? Does it always run operator upgrade against previous release without the version field? Or does it run Kafka upgrade from older Kafka version without upgrade?
For 0.19.0 it does both. But for example 0.18.0 -> 0.19.0 IIRC does not change Kafkas so it would test only operator upgrade. I think this should be clarified in the comments to know how and when should the version number be bumped. (in general, both tests might have their value)
